intro: Myrsine novocaledonica subsp. balabioensis, commonly known as the Balabio Island myrsine, is a species of flowering plant native to New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces small white flowers followed by red berries, which are an important food source for local wildlife. This subspecies is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of New Caledonia.
